intro: Hexonix, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a striking perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with a contrasting dark center. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern, giving it a compact appearance. Hexonix thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its unique floral structure and vibrant colors make it a standout in both wild and cultivated settings.
